title: Looking at the military plane, Granny remembered her husband, who has been killed by a bomb of a similar aircraft. Is this sentence correct? 'Looking at the military plane' is a participial phrase. - Quora

response.answer_text: Hmmm. First off, Granny is a term for a grandmother, which is feminine — thus, her instead of his. Gender reflects the Grandparent who is looking and possessing the memories, not the subject of the memories. Next, It’s a bid strangely structured structured. Instead of “military plane” consider the word “bomber”, which makes the statement that it was a bomb who killed the subject unnecessary: “Looking at the bomber, Granny/Gramps remembered her/his husband, who had been killed by a similar aircraft.”

Looking at the military plane, Granny remembered his husband, who has been killed by a bomb of a similar aircraft. Is this sentence correct? "Looking at the military plane" is a participial phrase. No. The sentence is not correct. Looking at the military plane - We would normally say warplane and it wouldn’t be looking it would be seeing. Granny remembered his husband - A Granny is normally a female parent of one of your parents. As such, it is doubtful that granny, being male, would have had a husband (same sex marriage being a fairly recent thing). It would not be capitalised as it is not a personal name. who has been killed by a bomb of a similar aircraft - If granny had been close enough to identify the aircraft that dropped the bomb that killed his/her husband, it is very doubtful whether granny would be alive to remember it. As a correction I would say, “Seeing the warplane was a painful reminder for granny that her husband had been killed in an air raid”.

Mismatched tense, looking and remembered does not match Run on sentence Use a ; before the whom to fix the run on or remove the first comma Also, who should be whom A bomb of a similar aircraft makes no sense … A possible fix would be Granny looked at the plane and remembered her husband, whom was killed by a bomb dropped from a similar plane
